class_notes: This course focuses on the origins of Socratic political philosophy by way of an exploration of the legal charges brought against Socrates that led to his trial and execution. We will begin with Aristophanes: 'Clouds' and Plato's 'Apology of Socrates.' We will then turn to a detailed examination of a series a shorter Platonic dialogues with a view to determining Socrates: guilt or innocence. This is a research course, so we will work together on developing 1) the art of close reading and interpretation, and 2) the art of writing a clear, well structured, and convincing paper. Some background in political philosophy is recommended, but not required.
course_description: Open only to senior and junior majors and others by permission of instructor. Selected topics in political science.
